subStages.name: Review and Refine Product Backlog
content: Ensure top backlog items are well-defined and prioritized
Break down larger items into sprint-sized stories if necessary
Update estimates based on new information
Identify any dependencies or blockers

subStages.name: Determine Sprint Goal
content: Collaborate with Product Owner to define sprint objective
Ensure goal aligns with overall project vision
Make sure the goal is specific, measurable, and achievable
Document the sprint goal

subStages.name: Check Team Capacity
content: Review team member availability for the sprint
Account for holidays, time off, and other commitments
Calculate total available person-hours for the sprint
Identify any skill gaps or resource constraints

subStages.name: Prepare Sprint Planning Agenda
content: Create a structured agenda for the meeting
Allocate time for backlog review, capacity planning, and task breakdown
Share agenda with team members in advance
Ensure all necessary materials and tools are ready

subStages.name: Review Sprint Goal and Backlog
content: Present the sprint goal to the team
Walk through top priority backlog items
Clarify any questions about user stories or acceptance criteria
Confirm team's understanding of the work to be done

subStages.name: Select Sprint Backlog Items
content: Discuss each potential sprint item
Assess item's alignment with sprint goal
Consider team capacity and velocity
Collectively decide which items to include in the sprint

subStages.name: Estimate Sprint Backlog Items
content: Review or create estimates for selected items
Use planning poker or other estimation techniques
Break down larger items into smaller tasks
Ensure total estimate aligns with team capacity

subStages.name: Create Sprint Backlog
content: List all selected user stories and tasks
Assign initial owners to tasks if appropriate
Identify any immediate blockers or dependencies
Visualize the sprint backlog (e.g., on a Scrum board)

subStages.name: Identify Sprint Risks
content: Brainstorm potential risks for the sprint
Assess likelihood and impact of each risk
Develop mitigation strategies for high-priority risks
Assign owners to monitor and manage risks

subStages.name: Plan Sprint Kick-off
content: Schedule a sprint kick-off meeting
Prepare to present sprint goal and backlog to wider team
Plan team-building or motivational activities
Ensure all team members understand their roles and responsibilities

subStages.name: Set Up Sprint Tracking
content: Prepare sprint burndown or burnup chart
Set up task board (physical or digital)
Establish any necessary metrics or KPIs for the sprint
Ensure all team members have access to tracking tools

subStages.name: Plan for Mid-Sprint Check-ins
content: Schedule any necessary additional meetings (e.g., design reviews)
Plan for regular progress updates
Identify checkpoints for reassessing sprint goal feasibility
Establish communication channels for raising issues or blockers

subStages.name: Review and Adjust Sprint Backlog
content: Do a final review of selected sprint items
Make any necessary adjustments based on team feedback
Ensure backlog items are fully elaborated and ready for work
Confirm team commitment to the sprint plan

subStages.name: Document Sprint Planning Outcomes
content: Record final sprint goal
List all sprint backlog items and their estimates
Document any key decisions or assumptions made during planning
Share sprint plan with stakeholders

subStages.name: Set Sprint Success Criteria
content: Define what constitutes a successful sprint
Ensure criteria are measurable and aligned with sprint goal
Get team and Product Owner agreement on success criteria
Document and communicate success criteria

subStages.name: Prepare for Sprint Execution
content: Ensure all necessary resources are available
Set up any required development environments
Confirm all team members are clear on their first tasks
Schedule recurring daily stand-up meetings
